definitions.definition: To fire in the opposite direction , for example due to an obstruction in the barrel .
definitions.label_groups: of a gun, cannon, Bunsen burner, etc. , intransitive

definitions.definition: To experience a premature ignition of fuel or an ignition of exhaust gases , making a popping sound .
To fail in a manner that brings down further misfortune .
examples: His attempt to make money by importing luxury cars backfired horribly when fuel prices tripled.

definitions.definition: To set a back fire ( small, controlled fire to limit spread of a larger fire ) .

main_definition: ( of a gun, cannon, Bunsen burner, etc. , intransitive ) To fire in the opposite direction , for example due to an obstruction in the barrel .
secondary_definitions: ( of a reciprocating engine , intransitive ) To experience a premature ignition of fuel or an ignition of exhaust gases , making a popping sound .
( idiomatic , transitive ) To fail in a manner that brings down further misfortune .
( firefighting ) To set a back fire ( small, controlled fire to limit spread of a larger fire ) .
